etymologies: 1940s. From scientific Latin Margarodidae, family name from scientific Latin Margarodes, genus name + -idae

definitions: Any scale insect of the family Margarodidae, some of which form pearl-like subterranean cysts on the roots of plants and can be a pest of grapevines.

notes.text: The cysts, which are known as ‘ground pearls’, are sometimes used as beads in parts of the West Indies and South Africa.

definitions: Of, relating to, or designating scale insects of the family Margarodidae.
